channel.title: Feel stupid for asking, Custom interface question
channel.description:
So I have a custom loyalty shop interface (not releasing by the way) and want to modify the text in it.. I assume you'd use the ClearQInterface crap. But in client.java I don't know where to place it.
[code] getPA().sendFrame126("Donor Points"+dpoints"", 12226);[/code]
What do I declare for it?

item.title: Feel stupid for asking, Custom interface question
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.source: Feel stupid for asking, Custom interface question

item.title: Feel stupid for asking, Custom interface question
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

You can send text with a packet. Not sure what yours would be since they name it by sendFrameOpcode(); But the packet opcode is 126. So you are looking for something like setInterfaceText or sendFrame126.

Read full topic
item.source: Feel stupid for asking, Custom interface question

item.title: Feel stupid for asking, Custom interface question
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“202685, post:2, topic:430014”]try going in texthandler.java… search for “180” scroll down to you action button 12226 and change
getPA().sendFrame126("", 12226);
to
getPA().sendFrame126(“Donor Points”+dpoints"", 12226);[/quote]
It’s an interface not an action button.

Read full topic
item.source: Feel stupid for asking, Custom interface question
